items.text: flighted outside off, driven to the right of sweeper cover
items.shortText: Mohammad Nawaz to Mohammad Mithun, 2 runs

items.preText: Mustafa Moudi: "Fun Numbers: Nawaz and Shadab have played 14 and 26 ODIs respectively (including this match). The first digits of both represent the No. of boundaries conceded by them today so far while the second digits of both represent the square root of the total no. of wickets picked up by each in ODIs !!" --- I'm just going to leave this comment here and marvel at it. Not bothering to check the math.
items.text: full outside off, uses his wrists to clip it down to long-on and walk to the other end to reach his 30th ODI fifty. A lovely little innings so far, and he's already shown in this tournament that he can push on to much bigger things
items.shortText: Shadab Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: floated up wider outside off, driven to sweeper cover
items.shortText: Shadab Khan to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: flat, short, sits up, pulled to the left of deep square leg
items.shortText: Shadab Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

items.text: dangled up wide of off. Slashes at it, away from his body, and slices it to the right of short third man to bring up the century partnership
items.shortText: Shadab Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

items.preText: Asad: "I have no idea what is up with Sarfraz. You finally have your quick bowlers producing results and you go on a 14 over spree of spin bowlers. Sarfraz's captaincy this Asia Cup has been questionable at times to say the least."
items.text: googly, too short and wide to trouble Mushfiqur, who leans back and cuts it to the left of sweeper cover. They go upstairs for a run-out appeal at the keeper's end, but Mushfiqur is back in time. Would have been in real trouble had the throw been closer to the stumps - Sarfraz had to pick it up well in front of them and then dive to break the wicket
items.postText:
Mian Jee: "Ban scoring 6-8 runs an over with ease off the spinners - unless we get few quick wickets here, Ban on track for a 275-300 total."

Saira: "Dhoni would have thrown that ball at stumps after collecting it." -- Yup - he'd have collected the throw and flicked the ball towards the stumps in one motion. Sarfraz actually dived towards the stumps.

Mushfiqur slowed down through the second half of his second run, and now we know why. He seems to be cramping up. The physio is on the field to attend to his right leg
items.shortText: Shadab Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

items.preText: Mushfiqur is back on his feet now.
items.text: slow, flighted googly outside off. Reads it well and clips with the turn through midwicket
items.shortText: Shadab Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Sarfraz has heard all of you. Here's some pace. Hasan Ali.
items.text: back of a length outside off. Not sure that was intentional. Probably not. Goes for a hard-hands punch and gets a thick edge that flies to the right of the keeper. No slip, though. Second time that's happened today
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball close to off stump, punched to deep point
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: bouncer over off stump, Mithun ducks under it
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: back of a length close to off stump, dabbed gently past the left hand of the diving backward point fielder
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: back of a length on off stump, jabbed to backward point
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: fullish, angling into middle stump, clipped to midwicket
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Junaid now, from left-arm round. No slip.
items.text: short, angling into off stump and cramping Mithun for room. Manages to hop and tuck it away nicely through square leg
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: full, angling down leg. Misses the flick and gets a tickle of pad on it down to fine leg
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 leg byes

items.preText: Chirag Sheth: "Kudos to Mushfiqur & Mithun. Second time in this series they have reconstructed the innings for Bangladesh. They were 3/3 against Sri Lanka & 11/3 today."
items.text: length ball angling into off stump from wide of the crease. Presses forward, looking for the push into the covers, ends up inside-edging into the leg side
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Mushfiqur stretched his leg after taking that single. Looks a little uncomfortable still.
items.text: bouncer outside off, sways his upper body away from the line
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: length ball on off stump, defended into the on side
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: back of a length on off stump, defended towards midwicket
items.shortText: Junaid Khan to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: Ihsaan: "Honestly if Mushfiqur Rahim doesn't get an IPL contract this season i will be surprised. Has all the shots, technique is perfect and a big game pressure player. The way he paces his innings he is pure class " -- And he keeps wicket, so theoretically he should be a highly sought-after player, but IPL auctions are strange things.
items.text: back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and defends into the point region
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: another lucky boundary for Mushfiqur. Sees him coming down the track and bangs it in short. Is hurried into a pull and only manages a top edge, but he places it perfectly, right over the keeper's head
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: short on off stump, pulled to deep square leg. Walks to the other end - I don't think his cramps have eased off completely yet
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: shot! The previous short ball got up to shoulder height. This one sits up at waist height, on off stump, and Mithun pulls it handsomely to the right of midwicket to bring up his second fifty of the tournament and the second fifty of his career
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.text: back of a length close to off stump, dabs gently towards backward point and gets to the other end
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: length ball on off stump. Looks for another sharp single to backward point but the ball travels too quickly to the fielder to allow it
items.shortText: Hasan Ali to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run
